content: One of the best 8bit RPG mobile games. If you were a fan of the Ultima series, you'll enjoy this game. I own all 3 Gurk games in the series. Wish there were more!
Ace game. Epic.
Great throwback 8 bit rpg

Excellent game! Wish there was a lot more games like this out there. Completely free, playable offline, no ads, no bullsh*t. Game is easy to pick up, play for a bit, set it down, come back to later, resume exactly where you were. It's a simple old school style tile-based turn-based crpg, with a big map and lots to explore. And noticeable improvements from Gurk II. If you like old school Dragon Warrior and Final Fantasy games, come give this a try.
Great old school rpg, like ultima on the original nes. I really hope they come out with more.
Fantastic rendition of a 80s era dungeon game, perfect for Android, and a masterful level of play and content. Series has improved with each release.
I love these games but it runs very slowly even considering the 8-bit style. I don't remember my speccy being quite as slow as this! Give it a speed boost please!
Great game Worth the $$ Please make #4

All these games are fantastic, and I have played this over and over and over again. I was doing a fresh playthrough and found a legendary item that I had never seen before and it brought me an absurd amount of joy. Borakash, Feraldan and Tazadar for the win!

All 3 gurks are a must have. I remember first playing gurk 1 on its initial release a long time ago. Its exactly what you expect and more. Great for og 8 bit rpg players. Brings me back to final fantasy 1 days, as astonishing as it may be.
This game is great. A throwback to old school RPGs. Simple, fun, more tactical than youd think initially, and with the 4 sets of class options, very replayable!
A brilliant game, perfectly made, good for hours of fun. Just the right pace for leisurely, addictive gameplay.
Loved it.
All these years later and I still pick it up to play a game every now and then.
Thank you for creating this game. I just completed all the quest and had a great time playing it. I'm going to take a short break and then reinstall it and play it again.
EDIT: The recent Android update broke this, they fixed it and it now runs better than ever! No more lag! Love this game, please make a 4th!
Bought it years ago, still have the beta i think..anyways i finished it all the way to the LAST boss and enjoyed it all..cant wait till 4!
I've only ever paid for 4 android games and 3 of them are Gurk. This is another excellent instalment - keep em coming
I wish the developers make the 4th one. :(
Beautifully crafted. I feel like I'm 11 years old again playing Ultima II on a 5.25" ðŸ’¾. I can't wait for Gurk IV!

Just started playing in earnest after years of piddling... Very nice! Its more challenging than I thought (underestimated the difficulty) and some of the mechanics are still unclear, but a very very enjoyable game! Very nostalgic and generally well thought through!
Amazing game! I want more!!!!
Very fun old school game.
I just discovered the Gurk series, and now, I'm totally Gurked!
Love it
Works on Android. thank you Lava!
replyContent: We've updated it to work on latest Android, should work fine now. Let us know!

content: When is gurk 4 scheduled to come out?? ??
2019.10.08 Most recent update fixed problems that prevented play due to system updates. Gurk III remains the best 8 bit style RPG available!
Great game. I've spent more time playing this than any other mobile RPG. So glad they fixed it so it runs on the latest version of Android!
Good game, its well worth buying
This game is so utterly brilliant, There has to be a Gurk 4! I have a tonne of ideas for the 4th installment... The world needs more GURK!!!
Didn't work but it does now! Woo Hoo! Thank you, one of my favorite games back on. Go team Larva labs!!!
replyContent: Hi Bob, the game should now work with our latest update. Sorry for the inconvenience!

content: I want to give 5 stars but I switched from Galaxy S6 to Google Pixel 3, and the game no longer works. Edit: game runs, but music doesn't play. Update it to 3 stars. Update: I was told it was fixed but there is still no music.
replyContent: Hi Jim, give it a try now-- our latest update should fix it.

content: This is definetly one of my favorite mobile games ever. Simple yet fun. Great replay value with all of the different classes. NO MICRO TRANSACTIONS. And the developers have kept up with the updates and paid attention to any issues. Highly recommend.
replyContent: Hi, we've resolved the issue now with our latest update, sorry you had this problem!

content: The game is an awesome, old school style 8bit RPG. When is Gurk 4 coming out?
Excellent game!. One of the best old-school CRPG experiences on Android made by a great and responsive developer. Please, keep it up!.
replyContent: Hi Pablo, thanks for your feedback. The latest release (1.23) resolves the portrait/landscape issue!

content: What a game. Gurk III is by far the best in the series and arguably the best RPG on this app store. Huge amounts of content, a variety of combat strategies thanks to its unique battle mechanics and varying characters/items, and an intriguing story. Buy this game - it deserves the money.
Thanks for the update to fix the new Android issue
I love this game. Will there ever be a Gurk IV?

**Edit** Thank you for addressing the issue. Game works once again. Back to 5 stars you go. This game truly is a gem! Original: Game no longer loads after Andriod Update. Just stays a grey screen with a box on load.. will change my review once fixed.
replyContent: Hi Matt, we've resolved the issue now with our latest update, sorry you had this problem!

content: This is a great game. A old 8-bit style rpg that just captivates the player. The developers also fixed the last update too!
replyContent: Hi, we've resolved the issue now with our latest update, sorry you had this problem!

content: Fun game that can be played anywhere, well maintained by the developers!
replyContent: Hi, sorry you had this issue. We've fixed the bug that prevented it from working on latest Android versions, so it should work fine now.

content: IT'S WORKING NOW! Thanks for the quick fix!
replyContent: Should work now with our latest update-- give it a try and let us know!

content: I like Gurk 3, but it is still incompatible on my Lenovo2109a tegra3.  Luckily my wife's machine will run it.
Won't load whatsoever on my device version (works now, thanks larva labs)
replyContent: Our latest update should fix the problem!

content: Great little game! Simple & fun. However, I recently downloaded again after a factory reset, but all I get are blank boxes where graphics should be, and no redponse
replyContent: Hi Christopher, we've updated the game to work on the latest Android release, give it a try and let us know if it works!

content: Game will not start now. 8-30-19
replyContent: Hi Michael, our update should fix the problem, give it a shot!

content: Loved the other two, unfortunately couldn't get this one to run on my s9+
replyContent: Should work now with latest update, give it a shot!

content: Doesn't work on Android
replyContent: Sorry you had an issue, we've updated it now to work on latest Android versions.

content: Its really fun i still play it in 2019
Will not run on my phone
replyContent: Hi Brant, should work now with our latest update.

content: Latest Android update broke the game
replyContent: Hi Bryan, we've resolved the issue now with our latest update, sorry you had this problem!

content: Gurk I was good, Gurk II was gooder, Gurk III was goodest. :) Seriously, played them all twice. Relaxing old-style D&D. More, please!
brilliant design. i am an old school gamer and this one really brings that feel back with a new age game wish the game was longer and had a sequel

Love the game played through it once and was maxing out my characters then bam it will not load anymore...S8+ It's only a gray screen with no buttons. I'm so disappointed I just want it to work :( I tried multiple uninstalls/ clear data/ restarts and nothing fixes it it issuch an odd problem. Still loved the game 5 stars but one playthrough is just not enough!
OMG....for a kid born in the 70's...who played Dungeons and Dragons....who played Wizardry as a kid...I love all three of the Gurk games!!!! Please make Gurk IV!!!!!!
The best Gurk title. The game is long enough. Combat is interesting and the gameplay doesn't feel repetitive. Definitely one of the best RPGs of the store
perfect
Make a forth please! all three were great games!

I love this game. I have played through it multiple times and I never get bored. I love how much it improved on Gurk 2, and I really like the faster actions. My only gripe is that some dungeons and towns feel empty. giant,  caverns of gray are not interesting to explore. I would really prefer if more time was put adding more optional encounters or loot staches. Other than that, I really hope you guys continue to make amazing Gurk games. I just can't wait until Gurk 4.  Also, I noticed a guy in the comments called: firstname lastname. He has a negative review for all the Gurk games and his only criticism is: "I don't like this genre of game." Not to mention the fact that he bought Gurk 2 and 3 even after his bad reviews!! He is clearly a troll and I want to tell you to ignore him. Or not, he is still a customer...  :)
More!!
excelent game. only downside is inventory managment.
This is a return to game. Well worth paying for.
I love this game!

After my last system update I can now play! Great job Larva. Awesome new features like the legendary artifacts are spectacular. Loving the simple gameplay of all the Gurk series. More than pleased. Keep releasing them and I'll keep buying and playing them.

A bug where the green exis key doesn't show up after you smash the statue completely prevents playing the rest of the game. You Have to start all over. Encountered it the second time and I am giving up. It is also very laggy.

In my opinion it would have been difficult to improve a game like Gurk II. Gurk III is way better: bigger, longer and with new game mechanics using buffs and fast actions.  Loved it!  Waiting for Gurk IV.
Amazing game reminds me alot of ultima exodus. Where is Gurk 4?
This game inspired me to finally start writing my own game. All 3 are great!

Once you learn to pick off the closest targets to your Warrior with Your Ranger, and let the enemy come to you...the game is easy. Here is to Gurk 4 being in 3D with cool Animation, but keep it simple.

Huh? ...it's 2018 & there is no need to make an RPG such as this.. I did not enjoy it on my tablet & probably wouldn't even like it on my wrist watch.. getting ohk'd by missile attackers directly after a no-text, no-explanation, no-nothing introduction was an indication of the potential banality ahead... uninstalled & refunded & taking a shower ðŸ¤”
Recent updates made this game a lot more stable and works a lot better on my phone thank you mr. Developer

While I enjoyed this game, I found that it wasn't as fleshed out as Gurk II. I'm convinced that there are other quests that I haven't stumbled upon yet, even though I have defeated "author" (no easy task). Still worth the money to entertainment value. But the ending is a leaves one a little flat. I look forward to buying the next one.
Its not bad game...been replaying for 3 years now
Super awesome game!!!!!
Need more games like this. The best

I am wondering when Gurk 4 will come out. I've played all of them and they 
are all great. Awesome value and lots of replayability.
Such a great interpretation of classic rpgs, love this game

Made me pay twice. Now i changed phones and its asking to pay again to 
reinstall. Great game though

Very nicely done game, could be better if random encounter rate was lower, 
but then you would level up slower.
Amazing

What an RPG should be. Admittedly, not too much of a step up from Gurk 2 
(main reason for only 4 stars.) However one change I like is the reduced 
"blockyness" however one thing a dislike in this game is the battle music. 
Ugh... Maybe it's just me but that music is the stuff of nightmares. Anyway 
4/5 pretty good other than the *shudder* battle music.
Much longer than the previous two games and with a bunch of extra moves and equipment that make it more fun.
I really love this game! Even though I bought it years ago, I can still pick up and enjoy a replay of this game. My save file has lasted longer than phones I've had!

I have been playing this series since the first Gurk, and i must say this third game of yours took a long time to complete the first time around and to this day still hasnt lost an ounce of its replay value. This is my third or fourth time beating this game and im having just as much fun time as i did with my first playthrough! ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- I only have one question, what soundtrack did you fellows use for the Edge World? The one with the cloaked man and a vast sea of stars. It has to be one of the most beautiful sounds ever made.
Love me some gurk!   Please make number 4!!
A joy to play & replay, this is exactly the type of game I would create myself if I had the time, inclination and coding ability.
Waiting for the 4th
What's happened to Gurk II?
Had a lot of fun.
Wonderful nod to the classic rpg! Soundtrack is great too
Absolutely worth the price.  A wonderful expansion from Gurk II.  Plenty of replay value.  Feels like my days playing games on my Apple ][.
Great game. Simple but elegant.
Took me back to 1982

Thankyou for making this beautiful game, old school graphics, turn based party combat RPG in a huge fantasy open world, I played them all start to finish, all of the Gurks feel well put together and polished, real gems.
Can't get enough Gurk!
Fantastic games, all 3 Gurks played and beaten. I wish they would have kept going with this series. I'd buy them all.
Great again. Thanks for the third Gurk!!
Un viaje increÃ­ble, maravillosa, del que no querrÃ¡s volver. Aunque tiene demasiados bugs.  Update: PLEASE MAKE ANOTHER ONE I DON'T CARE FOR THE BUGS JUST PLEASE MAKE GURK IV HAPPEN. Thank you.

Great retro style game, adding an option to have more that one save file in gurk four would definitely improve the experience, I'd start over now but I don't want to get all my characters back to level fifteen. Fast combat definitely improved upon gurk 2.
Awesome retro gaming! The plot is quite linear though.
Perfect for the phone. Well done old school RPG. Many thanks for your effort!
MAKE GURK 4, AND MAKE IT BIGGER THAN EVER BEFORE

Gurk 1&2 are great, and this game has been improved in every way. Controls, character progress, battles, magic, gameplay; all are better. Music (though good) is now mutable. The world feels more open than Gurk 2. The enemies seem to drop fewer items, but there are more shops. All in all, money well spent, and I'll buy the next one too.
I'm so disappointed. I've just completed Gurk II and loved it, so paid for Gurk III straight away. The lag sadly is so bad it actually prevents play.

Yay for Gurk. Yay again!  I really missed the old ultima game and when I found gurk it was even better. Gurk I was okay but was missing a plot but then I got Gurk III and it was the best ever! You really did a good job with everything. From the feel of the controls and menu items, to the story line and challenges and the enormous size of all the different worlds. I felt like there was no end to explore. I'm ready for gurk II, I hope it comes soon.  I really appreciate that there was no funny permissions to my phone and that you didn't try to sell me anything. I also love the price. Great bargain.  Yay even more!

I've enjoyed the series.  Would like another or perhaps a "maker" app that allows me to make my own Gurk world.  Dreaming, I suppose. Perhaps I'm just old (50) but I never noticed lag on my Samsung or LG.
Addictive, cute and nostalgic
Lovely!

Highly recommended!   First cellphone game that is actually worth my time! Game has gotten me through many long hours in waiting rooms at the hospital.   Bought the first 2 Gurks but this one is the best. The music totally sounds like Sega Game Gear and somehow feels more retro than the other 2.  Pick this up if you loved the Magic Candle Series on PC or Bloodstone back in the day or if you just like simple tactical retro RPGs!
Loved the game.  It's not as good as the ultima series. but it's a lot of fun. A bit faster speed on battles would be nice.
I love all 3 Gurk games.  When can we expect a forth!?!?!?!?!?!?!
Great, simple retro RPG. A nice addition to the Gurk trilogy. Only complaint is sporadic lag plagues movement at times.

The Gurk series is so far the only retro RPGs on Android that I was engaged enough to finish from beginning to end. It's a tight RPG with all the right "fun" ingredients and none of the unnecessary fluff. Highly recommended if you are into retro dungeon crawling.  To the developer: is Gurk IV in the works?
Great game for old time late 80's PC feel
Perfect
It's gurk
How good games should be. Author even shows up as a boss

This game is totally AWESOME! If I knew how good it would be when I bought it then I would have happily paid ten times more for it. Buy it now. There was at least 36 hours of fun, with great game balance and item development. The final battle is crazy :-) Thanks for the badge!
Unbelievably laggy! I know the graphics of this calibre might stutter now and end, but I'm surprised the N6P can't handle this game. Gurk I and II work fine.
Need more like it
Love the style, love the gameplay, love the strategy. Shops could use more items but otherwise perfect. I want more. When is 4 coming?
Are you working on gurk 4?
best game of the 3 gurks.music was addicting.story was great.and its replayable.this is my third time replaying it.
Mobile game ever

Played the first 2 and loved them. Was enjoying this one until the encounter with Kroga .  Tried almost 20 times and still can't defeat him and his minions - they are WAY TOO HARD ... so my advancement is stuck. Sad ... would have liked to have finished this game.
i beat it all several times. replayable. well done, great music. hope there is a Gurk IV one day.
Simply love these games
Need the next one. Every game I. The series gets better and better. I burned my way through the ones that are released, I need moar!!!!!!!!
I love the series, but this version is hard to recommend. Numerous bugs and dismal performance really kill the fun.

Easily the most fun Ive had with an Android RPG. Calls back to games that got me started with RPGs, like Ultima: Exodus. Played it through twice, and working on round 3. When are we getting Gurk 4 guys? Id buy it. Id pay more than what you asked for 2 and 3 too. For sure.
Android gaming cannot be the same as PC gaming. It has to be casual fun comma and perfect for idle time
Too laggy to play on Nexus 6P. It's a shame because it seems like it'd be a great game!
I love this series, but please fix the lag issues! I use Moto G with Marshmallow.
If you liked Ultima II then you'll really like this game.  very large worlds that just keeps going every time you th8nk you are near the end there's more.  easy to play in short spurts.
Its an amazing throwback to old rpgs
Love the Gurk games. Played all 3. Gameplay is addictive. Gurk II and Gurk III  game length was great too! Wish there was a Gurk IV.
Knocked it out of the park! Gurk4????????...
Played all three Gurk games now and loved them all. Genuinely a bit sad now I've completed this one. Refreshing to have a game you don't have in app purchases for to complete
Sometimes lags and would really benefit from multiple saves. Has some replayability value.
The story is great, but man, that laggy interface. It makes doing anything frustrating.
Had so much fun playing all 3 versions! Will you make another? I'd pay for it!

This is the offline RPG you want. It should be a 1million download app by now. Tell your friends about this app. It is a simple yet well done game. Nostalgic but has its own style. Perfect game to enjoy and you'll find yourself having a hard time putting it down.
Good game could be better though
I really enjoyed the first two... This one will be hard to top, please, please, please make it so you can have more than one save slot.
When will we get Gurk IV? PLEASE!
One of my favorite games on play. Wish there were more like it.
The game's simple, still perfect. I've been playin it since the first one and will buy all the sequences.  A MUST have!

Okay, now it's third game and this is amazing. Almost every issues and frustrations about Gurk I and II has been fixed. Simply put, it keeps getting better 'n better. I just love this game and I'm having trouble to turn it off. There are some frustrations still, but who cares. This is must play game if you like old school RPG.
I love the gurk series. please continue making them!

I've bought all three games and I've enjoyed them all. My opinion: I liked Gurk 3 more than Gurk 1 but I liked Gurk 2 more than 3. Gurk 3 has more replay value than Gurk 2 though. They are all fun games. Definitely worth $2 dollars!
better than the first 2 and still gives the good authentic nostalgia. could be 5 stars if they included cloud save and fixed the clunky interface and menu system. otherwise great.
Great game but lags on Moto G 2nd gen! Will give it 5 when fixed.
It's crazy sluggish
The first two gurk games were great. This game lags so bad it's on the line of unplayable.
Love it! Every new edition gets better. I hope the series continues!
This harkens back to early Ultima games.  Love it!  Some devices play super laggy (Note 4) but others play just fine (Nexus 9)
Not. Way way laggy.

Love it, love the 2nd one, love the 1st one. Update the UI, or don't, and just make a 4th one. Screw the UI, just gimme more. Just add a buck to the cost on each sequel. People like me will keep giving you money until everyone on the dev team dies of drug overdoses. Keep up the kickass work.
very slow, playability very low, opposite to previous gurk 1 and 2. i decided to uninstall this laggy app
Best Android game
Lags on new phone.
One and two were great. This one is laggy. How can an 8bit game be laggy?

Loved Gurk 3 even more than 1 and 2 ! Amazing value for $2. Great replayability as well. For those who love RPGs and remember when gaming was simpler. Just the right balance of treasure/fighting/adventuring. Don't miss it ! OnePlus One, no lag that I noticed.
Ditto
When is gurk 4 coming out!
I love this game and this series which is why I am so unhappy when it lags on either my S4 or my Nexus 6. I would be really happy if the devs can fix the lag.
Cant find a way to copy my save file from my old Android device to my new one.  Will rate 5 stars if someone resolves my issue.
Once you learn it this game plays really quickly and being able to save at any time makes it great for playing in short sessions
Slow on my lg g3 but not on a Samsung s3.. Please tweak, fix, whatever! Oh, and release a gurk 4!!
Runs fine on xperia z3 compact.  Takes a few seconds to load.  Just as fun as the last two

The traits of each individual character give replay value, which was the only thing lacking before. The Westernlands, giving you a whole other map to explore was exciting as well.  I'd gladly play $3 for a Gurk 4!

Best rpg I've played on mobile, low price with no in app purchases. 8 hours in I feel like I'm just starting the game, solid rpg feel. Unfortunately when you clear a dungeon boss you have to get all the way back through the dungeon and wilderness back to town to heal, encountering monsters which usually kills you. Needs a teleport system. Also needs a way to revive downed characters after fights. Aside from that it's the best 2 dollars I've spent for my phone.
Lagging a bit now

This is a very fun game, and I was really excited for it. Then I started playing and everything I did lagged horribly. So much so that most of the time is hard to tell what exactly is going on. Please fix it. I really want to play this game to its full extent, but it's really difficult to play with lag.
I love this whole franchise! Gurk 1 is good,  but simple. Gurk 2 runs much smoother; but all of them are worth the purchase.

No other game or app comes close to Gurk. It is elegant in all its 8-bit glory! I believe less is more when it comes to video games and this game perfectly illustrates why that is true. It is simple yet challenging and creative. I just found "Author" and that pretty much made my whole day. I will destroy you, Author!  (And no, I will not stop playing- ever. I expect Gurk IV!)
A huge improvement on the first two. my only question is where to go after you get the badge of honor? I can't figure it out
I really enjoy it; but for some reason, while it worked fine on my Samsung S4 but lags badly on my LG G4. Gurk I and II work fine on my LG.
Love the series. To bad you cannot Finnish this one.
Awesome game. Will there be a 4?
A great rpg for your phone.
This is the best of the three episodes.  The battles are enjoyable and the game did not run out of challenges right up to the final battle.
Every now and then its icon on the home screen changes to the android logo. Error reports say its classNotFound exception. Why does this happen?? Reinstalled, worked fine but later it happened again.
While running the previous games, the entire top half of my screen was the game. Now, the screen is about half the size of Gurk II, and it is difficult to see the game. Please fix this ASAP.
Too much 8 bits m8
I completed the piyun temple but the quest didn't complete, gutted can't finish the game...

This game is just simply fun. Its almost Skyrim for phones. On my tablet the buttons are missing but I played it on my phone so much that I can play the game successfully with no problem. I am a huge fan of the series and look forward to seeing the bug fix and future  games.
Game still broken!!! Even after Oct 2014 update.    I loved Gurk II and would love to give this game five stars, but the game's buttons often disappear making it unplayable. So sad. Don't buy it!
Simple grind, but addicting
Awesome game. But too short IMO. When can we expect gurk 4?
Venturing into the land of Gurk for a third time!
Love it.
Please fix the slowness and the lag. I will give 5 stars only after those two things are fixed
All Gurk games are perfect. This one makes no exception.
Great old school rpg.
Great music, battles are faster, has a basic story. Just a fun little game for your phone.
Never mind,  I'm an idiot. I LOVE this game. When are we getting Gurk 4????????
Mmm....chips.
Love the new interface all that crap. But am I the only one who remembers Gurk 1 being about 256kB? I'm amazed at how much its grown.

Sometimes moving can get laggy and no it's not my phone. Also the item equiping interface gets annoying since its not exactly... smooth. Other than that a great game, played them all and it can seem similar at first but it starts to really show its new stuff as you get into it.
Gurk III
My buttons dont show up on the screen! They're there, but I cant see them.  I refunded but will get it again if you can fix it.

I hope there is a Gurk 4. I'll be buying it ASAP. My main wish for Gurk 4 would be to give the warrior better end game integration. When ranged attacks take over the warrior becomes a weak archer who's mele skills make him a danger to him self.
Simple graphics, but a fantasticly addictive game
Every bit as gurky as you'd want. Somehow not too gurky, though, which is pleasant.
I love this game, it ran perfect on a previous version but since a recent update its laggy :/ already purchased and would love a fix :)
This game is so much fun. My only gripe is the semi-frequent lag that I've seen across a couple of flagship phones.
Need more!!! Any plans for Gurk IV??
From the interesting story, to the brilliant and funny monster descriptions, to the music, it's worth every cent.  I await Gurk IV.

Super disappointed with Gurk 3. It's sooo slow. Too slow to play in my opinion and I even selected 'fast combat'. If I was playing fast combat, I would hate to see what regular combat is like. I enjoyed Gurk 2, but this one isn't working for me and I'm using a high end phone.
Gurk III stays true to the series delivering the same handheld RPG experience I've grown to love.

Each Gurk gets better and better! The new class selection is amazing. Monsters and quests are far better balanced, and with the improved HP/SP regeneration and Salve drop rates, you're free to do either quests or exploring without having to grind xp and gold. Theres also a lot of unique weapons and armor to get, so you don't need to farm gold to afford the expensive items. My only complaint is that there is STILL decent way to sort your inventory.
Awesome game but EXTREMELY slow and laggy on my HTC Droid DNA. Barely bearable. Gurk 1&2 ran perfect on the first Moto Droid. Please fix?
Please make part four!!!
Great throw back. Look forward to GU (Gurk Online) MMORPG!

Pros - another Gurk . . . oh how I live these games Cons - the interface is slow and laggy.  This steals a lot of the fun out of the game.  This also needs the ability to save game to a specific location - this is a major issue for phone junkies like me who have a new phone every few months.

As the title, Gurk, Gurk 2, and 3 have been awesome, all solid retro rpg games and I can't wait for 4! If I ever had a complaint, a volume slider and a sort inventory would go far, but just little nitpicks
I'm looking forward to Gurk IV!

Last night I sat down to play about 10 minutes of this game to fall asleep. That was at 9PM (I needed to get up early). But before I knew it, it was 11:30. This is a great game you can pick up at anytime, right where you left off.

On bigger screens like my 5.5 inch buttons and play area is waaaaay too small, buttons are tiny and text is almost unreadable. The previous versions were much better from this pow.. A pity for such an otherwise great game!
Game keeps going back to title screen during gameplay and freezes there. I want a refund. One touch evolve.
Nice old school game that delivers. Would be nice to have a second save file.
great RPG! so much fun, old school style.
I didn't even think twice when I saw this for sale.
Been a huge fan of the Gurk series since the first. Recent update fixed missing ui buttons.  Worth every penny,  if you enjoy old Ultima style RPGs.
Great game endless hours of fun

Do yourself a favor; purchase and download this game. It is so much fun. It has the correct amount of RPG complexity for a mobile game; which is great for newcomers and veterans of the genre. I have played all three Gurk games and this is by far the best. At the price they are asking this game is a steal. Looking forward to Gurk 4!!
a bit slow at times but a good game
goes on forever with hours and hours and days of great gameplay. one of my favorite games of all time.
Keep making them and I'll keep buying them!
Exactly what you want in a 8bit rpg. Have playrd and beaten all 3 several times :)

If it weren't for the horrible performance, it would get 5 stars easily.

The Gurk games are the BEST old-school RPGs I've found on the Android OS, and I've looked at a lot of offerings. Gurk III adds even more quality-of-life improvements over Gurk II, like a slightly refined battle system and a MUCH longer storyline with an enormously expanded world. It even has extra, "hidden" characters you can unlock after beating the game for the first time. Combined with the games' overall quality, the Gurk series is worth every penny, and I devoutly hope there will be a Gurk IV someday.

High playability, there are new enemies with a variety of challenging abilities, and the characters are more individualized than the last game. An improvement on a great game! With the addition of some new quests, I would definitely play through again! However, this one complaint isn't worth deducting a star.

This is the best RPG on Android right now, and I'm pretty sure I've played all of them.  The Gurk series combines all that is essential and fun about RPGs - engaging battle tactics, a great variety of items, quests, serious challenges, and a wide world to explore - without any of the frills like fancy-pants graphics that make games so expensive today. Anyone who pines for the days of SquareSoft's golden age will recognize the subtlety in Gurk 3 (and its predecessors). Two things are a testament to the skill of the designers: (1) The game's "economy" (earn gold, sell items, buy better items) is always in equilibrium, a good player will never be desperately poor but will also never have huge excess reserves. And, (2) The game's level of difficulty progresses very smoothly, so a decent player can play straight through, without ever having to grind out some extra levels to survive, and without ever finding the game has become too easy. I can't wait for Gurk 4! Please, take my money.
Unplayable.  Game buttons disappear.  Loved gurk 1/2.
Didn't think it could get any better than Gurk II. I will buy Gurk XXVII

Y'know, the gurk series proves that good gameplay doesn't depend on 60fps fancy 3d graphics. I've had more fun with this game than many other graphics-heavy apps out there. This latest addition to the gurk series adds new monsters, interesting abilities (and different characters with different abilities to choose from), and better world interaction. And a *huge* world to explore! Highly recommended for ole skool rpg fans!

I've gotten pretty far in that Past day. I played 1 & 2, So without a doubt I had to get 3. This is better than the first two. There's a couple minor glitches in certain parts on the World but its no buggy. . . Overall; Excellent game, defiantly worth the 2$.

I'm a huge fan of Gurk and Gurk II with their great atmosphere and adventure that just keeps pushing you forward even when you want to go to sleep. Unfortunately the third installment lost those two critical ingredients. After the first three quests you  just have a feeling you've done all this before. Combine this with not-only-occassional glitches in the UI, game controls disappearing (Galaxy S), strange lags in gameplay and the disappointment finally makes you hit Uninstall, not interested in the least what's beyond the Great elven tree.

Gurk 2 was such an improvement over the original Gurk that I was wondering what new ground Gurk 3 could possibly tread. Not a whole lot, it turns out, but that's okay because Gurk 2 so perfected the formula that there weren't a whole lot of remaining leaps and bounds to make.  Not that there isn't anything new: Gurk 3 does refine the turn-based RPG formula and expand it ever so slightly, deepening strategic depth while streamlining some of the clunkier aspects of gameplay. I'm definitely curious to see where the Gurk series can go from here--a trilogy of 16 bit RPGs, maybe?--but for now Gurk 3 wraps up in brilliant, addicting fashion what the original Gurk kicked off so many years ago.

This was a no-brainer for $0.99.  I've spent the last two weeks and many hours playing through the newest Gurk expansion.  If you've played the first two, you'll know what to expect: many different enemies, huge continents, oceans, castles and caves to explore and tons of treasure.  It's also good for quick sessions as you can save anywhere.  I usually get games, but never finish them.  This one kept my attention to the end.
'Honestly, stop playing. I've completely run out of ideas!'  Wooohoo BADGE OF HONOR!... NOW MAKE ANOTHER GURK.

Great game so far.   Best new feature = "fast battle."  If you've played the previous games, you'll love this game.    Only criticism would be that sometimes I don't have an active quest and I don't know what to do next.  Also, I wish they'd show how much each attack was... right now you need to see/remember what previous hp was and then mentally subtract from what hp is after the attach.  Pretty minor gripes.  Great game.

Gurk 3 builds on the previous two games with new character options, artifacts, and special items.  I enjoyed the game quite a bit, until I got to the last dungeon.  The threat level suddenly scales up, even with my party at level 15 I found myself being frustrated again and again.  It can be so hard in some spots it's almost like the game designers don't have an ending, and that particular encounter is just meant to end your party.
Please keep making these! Would love to see you tackle a D&D style game soon...

This installment of Gurk is a huge step forward in terms of game mechanics and replayability. Status effects, skills, legendary artifacts - It's all there. Tough battles, huge areas to explore, and some non-linear advancement possibilities made the game very enjoyable. That being said, I wish the story was as good as the mechanics. Sure, there is a plot, but it does not feel well connected and the end (was it the end? I dunno) is very ungratifying. Also would have appreciated some more NPCs in the cities to really get into the 80s RPG mood.  .
Amazing... As always
I really enjoy the Gurk series but this game suffers from extreme slowdown that make it almost unplayable. I newer had this problem with the two previous games. I hope it gets fixed!
Glad to see the third installment and I hope you are working on #4.  Occasionally when I open the game the controls don't show.

I have been a gurk fan from the beginning.  if you liked old rpgs like the Ultima series, you will love this game. only suggestion I would say is to have the weapons/armour/etc be able to be compared to items in the store/won/found instead of constantly opening menus to do so but overall amazing game I'm looking forward to future gurk games

I'm in the arena in the wastelands and there seems to be an invisible wall that prevents me from entering the arena!! Why devs why??? Please fix this bug asap as I want to continue on my adventure in gurk land!!!
replyContent: Unfortunately you are stuck there, if you start again you won't be able to get to that area. You must have saved right prior to the update that fixed that loophole. Very sorry!

content: Im a big Gurk fan. Love this game as much as the others. Simple and fun to play yet challenging. My.favorite rpg. Great job! Keep.em coming.

While I had some problems with the control pad occasionally disappearing, everything was still very playable and enjoyable. My main complaint is that there was no credit scroll at the end like there was after completing gurk 2 (unless I haven't actually finished yet despite completing all quests and fully exploring the extra area after the "final boss") which makes the end feel a little slapped together and incomplete as compared to the former version. Despite this, still the best droid rpg on the market.
Start the game move once and the menu disappears cant even play.
...for a great game AND for being a responsive developer. =) Sorry for being a jerk.
replyContent: Gurk I - fixed!

content: I love these games.  Good story line, familiar controls, and 8 bit monster bashing, magic wielding mayhem!
I was hoping, ceaselessly praying for Gurk III. I'm glad, to know larva labs brings epic RPG happiness.
Lose sight of controls after 5 minutes of play.

On the Samsung galaxy gt-p1000 the display is clipped showing only 40% of the gaming area,  this renders the game unplayable as text cannot be fully read. Please fix the previous gurk games were excellent hence the five stars.

Absolutely amazing game! I'm pretty sure I was one of, if not THE, first Gurkers to buy and download #3! Now, I hope I'm one of the first to beat it! And much to the Author's dismay, I can't stop Gurkin', so please give us #4! I'm more than willing to help, if I can.
So. Much. Fun. So. Little. Money. Spent. Best. Game. On. Android.
Good strategy and difficulty, longevity thru grinding and gear, legendary especially etc..  I'm a sucker for shopping runs in town too. Worth much more than $2.
Screen not centered and can't change options, otherwise great

Well, RPG, at any rate, although frankly it's better than Angry Birds, or whatever. This developer knows that on a mobile device less is more. The graphics and story are cute, the progression is solid and game play is easy. The developer (who does this as a hobby) is responsive and eager to fix problems. This is a very fun RPG.

Loved Gurk, bought Gurk II and enjoyed it intensely (but it was over quite fast). The third Gurk, with nearly 17MB, should be awesome! For 1.50 euro I am not thinking twice, now going to play it :-) Just finished it with all-female team. A configurable button for most used actions would be a great improvement, I spammed Essense of Fury every fight...

I just finished beating the game.  Easily the best one in the series.   Lots of new features such as monster descriptions that add to the overall feel of the game.  The quest system is better than in Gurk 2, the character generation seems much more professional, and the overall game balance (magic system, stats, and leveling) is very good.  It was *easily* worth every penny it costs.  If you want a fun, solid 8-bit Rpg, this is the best I've found.  (I played on a Samsung Galaxy Note 2)
Wonderful retro RPG with great gameplay improvements. Please keep them coming
I see that this game has potential but I don't know what has to be done! There isn't any instruction or manual so I am lost. I really hope to see this featured in a future update.
Awesome

Runs well on my S3 but disappointed to see no improvements in the game interface. Too many button presses required to carry out frequent actions. Embracing a retro aesthetic doesn't excuse poor design. I enjoy the game just frustrated with controls.

I love the game so far I've followed since the first gurk but it unfortunately freezes a lot in the westlands and it freezes during the vampire fight and they're very hard so it'd be great to fix these bugs thanx :)
Perfect game, wouldn't change a thing. Look forward to the next instalment

I knew this game was coming soon but I didn't expect it this soon. As soon as I saw it available a couple of days ago, I dropped everything and bought it. Gurk 3 looks a lot like two earlier games in the series, and that's a good thing: no other Android rpg delivers a aatisfying old  school, tactical turn-based party-oriented roleplaying adventure. Good job stretching out the display for my galaxy s4. Gurk 2 only used about half the screen so I was leery while downloadimg this. All in all, a must-buy!
Probably the best Gurk in the world.
Quit reading this and just go play it (and if you haven't played Gurk and Gurk II then why not?!)

Joy to play, many possibilities and two countries to discover! Sail the see, explore vast plains, gloomy dungeons, fight monsters and buy better weapons!  This game is suitable even for someone not experienced with RPG, Dungeons and Dragons etc. Just play and enjoy this adventure for few bucks.  And the oldschool C64-like music is simply cool!
I bought it the second I saw it. I played all the games in the series so far and I plan on supporting them for a long time to come. 5 out of 5.
Again you did it! Rivaling Gurk II as best rpg on android. Thank you so much!
Finally! The coolest 8bit RPG on android returns, hours of fun, simply delightful & full of nostalgic nuggets of joy.

I loved Gurk 2 because it reminded me of some of the classic rpgs of the eighties and nineties. This game is more of the same with some subtle improvements. The combat system has a few more tweaks and there are more random bosses/treasure. This game is excellent! Can't wait for Gurk 4!
This reminds me of the old days of The Bards Tale and many others. A must have for only $2!
This is an excellent RPG but where is the manual?  What does blessed do?  What does a +1 amulet do?  I'd love to learn more about the mechanics of the game.
A perfect follow-up to the excellent Gurk 2.  Subtle playability changes and a few enhancements but otherwise the same, which is exactly what I wanted.  Great job.
Love it... kinda lost atm but still fun. I will keep buying
This is the #1 rpg game available for android phones...I've played most and this one has the best maps, monsters, storyline, weapons, and character battle setup. Love, love, love it! <3
Excellent!
I am oh so going to enjoy this game.

This game looks to be far superior to its predecessor Gurk 2.  However the game does have a few bugs in it still which is to be expected for a new release.  Once the majority of these bugs have been fixed I would rate it as a 5 with no hesitation.  Despite the early problems with the game I would still recommend that you purchase it.
Gurk just gets better and better

I've stuck with this series since the first installment. It stands as my favorite RPG to play on the phone. It is slightly more difficult than the second one, in most aspects, which I find ti be a good thing.
See title.
Not working on Asus TF300
5 stars until proven otherwise, can't wait to start playing :D
Buttons appear and dissapear on my phone and the main screen is too small. 5 stars anyways, because it's a great game.
I played the beta, and it was very good. Simple and elegant controls makes everything very easy to use.  Buying to support dev and to get the extras!
Another surely brilliant installation in the Gurk series. Keep on keeping on devs. I'll be a Gurk follower forevermore. I love you.
Perfection!
The most anticipated sequel of the most anticipated sequel of the original Gurk! And look at the size of this game. I think I'm going to enjoy this.
A sip of fresh air after much too difficult JRPGs, this game plays like a breeze.
Played through the beta version twice, I'm may not do it again, but this dev certainly deserves the two bucks. I hope there will be a 4.
Now with more lady characters!
